examples: They’re the ugly ducklings of the supernova family, but their weirdness is what makes them so valuable.
When he observed newly hatched ducklings and geese, he discovered that waterfowl in particular had no innate recognition of their mothers.
The father of seven made news in 2013 after rescuing a group of ducklings trapped in a drainage ditch, leading them to a nearby pond to be with their mother.
These goslings are born with an extra dense coat of down feathers.
As the goslings grow, they develop more elaborate vaned feathers.
So when incubator-hatched goslings spent their first hours with Lorenz, not only did they follow him, but they showed no recognition of their real mother or other adults in their species!
She wrote her name in beautiful cursive handwriting.
The handwriting on the wall bodes poorly for many aquatic species, but there is hope that we can make some changes to save some of them.
We use our notebooks to practice writing and improve our handwriting skills.
The professor's handwriting on the whiteboard was messy and unintelligibly scribbled, making it challenging for the students to read and follow the notes.
'I know the Duke's handwriting.
words.defineEn: the activity of writing by hand

examples: Or did you have an inkling?
In fact, the first fossil to give us an inkling that dinosaurs had feathers was actually one of the earliest specimens ever found.

In it we can see the beginnings of the cult of the individual that has since taken hold, inklings of the now widespread thirst to share our everyday views of the world, each from our own angles and in our own styles.
So then I asked Barry if he thought Trader Joe's perhaps had inklings of the paradox of choice in mind when designing their shopping experience.
And that's why I say, what you need to look at first, will be the first inkling, is the number of new cases each day, the relative proportion.
words.defineEn: a slight suggestion or vague understanding
words.defineVi: một gợi ý nhỏ hoặc sự hiểu biết mơ hồ
(thường là số nhiều) trang phục phụ kiện

words.defineEn: a young animal, usually a horse or a deer, that is between one and two years old
words.defineVi: một con vật nhỏ, thường là ngựa hoặc hươu, từ một đến hai tuổi

examples: Water slowly moves through its cul-de-sac shape and encounters the world's largest freshwater dunes, many wildlife species, and unique fossilized coral.
In October 2011, she spotted an old office building in a quiet Kensington cul-de-sac and offered four and a quarter million pounds for it.
My daddy invented the wheel My daddy invented inventions My daddy put up a cardboard cutout of himself in our cul-de-sac for crime prevention.
words.defineEn: a street with one closed end
words.defineVi: một con đường có một đầu bịt kín

examples: SUSAN GLASSER - That's what I'm thinking of, is The Sword and the Shield, which was this television series that basically recounted the derring-do of Soviet spies in World War II.
words.defineVi: chiến công dũng cảm và anh hùng

examples: The subtle bitterness of artemisia balanced the sweetness of the dessert.
You can reduce the bitterness of sour gourd by soaking it in saltwater before cooking.
She loved the slight bitterness of endive, which added complexity to her dish.
He picked a few rue leaves from the garden to add to his soup for a touch of bitterness.
- Bitterness, what are you working on?
words.defineVi: một cách thô bạo và cay đắng

examples: The closed lid of the jar preserved the freshness of the food inside.
The tobacco products included a humectant to maintain the moisture content and freshness.
You can use coriander as a garnish for your tacos to add a burst of freshness.
The bakery used a glazing agent to give their pastries a delightful shine and preserve their freshness.
- Also the basil adds some freshness.
words.defineEn: the property of being pure and fresh (as if newly made); not stale or deteriorated
words.defineVi: đặc tính trong sạch và tươi mới (như thể mới được tạo ra); không cũ hoặc xuống cấp

words.defineEn: a lack of affection or enthusiasm
words.defineVi: thiếu tình cảm hoặc sự nhiệt tình

examples: Gods are full of righteousness.
And we install the values of individualism and righteousness and meritocratic values, etcetera.
But it had to be based in some sort of moral righteousness, and Glenn had the perfect phraseology that took this anger and channeled it into an organization that rose up from nowhere.
Probably most important to us today, and certainly most important to Jesus, this god demands moral righteousness and social justice.
words.defineVi: tuân thủ các nguyên tắc đạo đức

words.defineEn: a state of arrangement or appearance
words.defineVi: một trạng thái sắp xếp hoặc xuất hiện

words.defineEn: the quality of being poor and inferior and sorry
words.defineVi: chất lượng kém và kém và xin lỗi

words.defineEn: a sudden and decisive change of government illegally or by force
words.defineVi: một sự thay đổi đột ngột và quyết định của chính phủ bất hợp pháp hoặc bằng vũ lực
